file.content:
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/).

## [0.4.3] - 2026-02-12

### Added

- Layered secret detection using gitleaks patterns alongside entropy-based scanning ([#280](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/280))
- Multi-agent rewind and resume support for Gemini CLI sessions ([#214](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/214))

### Changed

- Git hook installation now uses hook chaining instead of overwriting existing hooks ([#272](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/272))
- Hidden commands are excluded from the full command chain in help output ([#238](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/238))

### Fixed

- "Reference not found" error when enabling Entire in an empty repository ([#255](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/255))
- Deleted files in task checkpoints are now correctly computed ([#218](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/218))

### Docs

- Updated sessions-and-checkpoints architecture doc to match codebase ([#217](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/217))
- Fixed incorrect resume documentation ([#224](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/224))
- Added `mise trust` to first-time setup instructions ([#223](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/223))

### Thanks

Thanks to @fakepixels, @jaydenfyi, and @kserra1 for contributing to this release!

## [0.4.2] - 2026-02-10

<!-- Previous release -->

content.thinking:
Now I have enough information to create a changelog. Let me categorize the changes:

**Added:**
- Support Gemini transcript format in explain command (#236)
- Add Gemini transcript condensation tests (#236)

**Changed:**
- Handle gemini as gemini, everything else as claude for now (#236)
- Safer agent hook parsing, make sure we preserve unknown hook types (#314)
- Use general logic for commit author for initial checkpoints branch commit (#262)
- Ensure auto commit sets up git hooks too, move to earlier in the flow (#298)

**Fixed:**
- Clarify --local/--project flags reference .entire/ settings, not agent settings (#306, fixes #279, #293)
- Delete all references to entireID (#285)
- Don't ask to enable again (when already enabled)

**Docs:**
- Update readme (#312)
- Add requirements to contributing guide (#231)

Let me write a clean changelog entry.

content.text:
Based on the commits since v0.4.3, here's the changelog update:

```markdown
## [0.4.4] - 2026-02-13

### Added

- Gemini transcript support in the `explain` command for viewing session history ([#236](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/236))

### Changed

- Agent hook parsing is now safer and preserves unknown hook types ([#314](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/314))
- Auto-commit strategy now sets up git hooks earlier in the enable flow ([#298](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/298))
- Initial checkpoints branch commit now uses the user's git config for author info ([#262](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/262))
- Simplified agent identification: Gemini handled explicitly, others default to Claude ([#236](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/236))

### Fixed

- Clarified `--local`/`--project` flags help text to indicate they reference `.entire/` settings, not agent settings ([#306](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/306))
- Removed deprecated `entireID` references ([#285](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/285))
- `entire enable` no longer prompts when already enabled

### Docs

- Updated README ([#312](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/312))
- Added requirements section to contributing guide ([#231](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/231))
```

Would you like me to add this to the CHANGELOG.md file?

content.thinking:
So the "don't ask to enable again" commit was sneaked into PR #231 (docs/update-contributing-requirements), which was originally just for adding requirements to the contributing guide. That's why it doesn't have its own PR - it was included with other commits in that docs PR.

I should point this out to the user - this change was part of PR #231 but the PR title doesn't reflect this behavioral change.

content.text:
It was bundled into PR #231 (`docs/update-contributing-requirements`) along with "Co-pilot feedback" and "Add requirements to contributing guide" commits:

```
git log --oneline 46f74c20^1..46f74c20^2
966e0df2 don't ask to enable again
1d919c64 Co-pilot feedback
a8b6afa9 Add requirements to contributing guide
```

So technically it has a PR, but the PR title doesn't reflect this behavioral change. I can either:
1. Attribute it to #231 (accurate but potentially confusing given the PR name)
2. Leave it without a PR number (what I did)
3. Note it differently, e.g., "([#231](...))" with a comment that it was bundled

Which would you prefer?

## [0.4.4] - 2026-02-13

### Added

- Gemini transcript support in the `explain` command for viewing session history ([#236](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/236))

### Changed

- Agent hook parsing is now safer and preserves unknown hook types ([#314](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/314))
- Auto-commit strategy now sets up git hooks earlier in the enable flow ([#298](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/298))
- Initial checkpoints branch commit now uses the user's git config for author info ([#262](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/262))
- Simplified agent identification: Gemini handled explicitly, others default to Claude ([#236](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/236))

### Fixed

- Clarified `--local`/`--project` flags help text to indicate they reference `.entire/` settings, not agent settings ([#306](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/306))
- Removed deprecated `entireID` references ([#285](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/285))
- `entire enable` no longer prompts when already enabled ([#231](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/231))

### Docs

- Updated README ([#312](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/312))
- Added requirements section to contributing guide ([#231](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/231))

## [0.4.3] - 2026-02-12

## [0.4.4] - 2026-02-13

### Added

- Gemini transcript support in the `explain` command for viewing session history ([#236](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/236))

### Changed

- Agent hook parsing is now safer and preserves unknown hook types ([#314](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/314))
- Auto-commit strategy now sets up git hooks earlier in the enable flow ([#298](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/298))
- Initial checkpoints branch commit now uses the user's git config for author info ([#262](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/262))
- Simplified agent identification: Gemini handled explicitly, others default to Claude ([#236](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/236))

### Fixed

- Clarified `--local`/`--project` flags help text to indicate they reference `.entire/` settings, not agent settings ([#306](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/306))
- Removed deprecated `entireID` references ([#285](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/285))
- `entire enable` no longer prompts when already enabled ([#231](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/231))

### Docs

- Updated README ([#312](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/312))
- Added requirements section to contributing guide ([#231](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/231))

## [0.4.3] - 2026-02-12
toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Changelog

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file.

The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/),
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/).

## [0.4.3] - 2026-02-12

### Added

- Layered secret detection using gitleaks patterns alongside entropy-based scanning ([#280](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/280))
- Multi-agent rewind and resume support for Gemini CLI sessions ([#214](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/214))

### Changed

- Git hook installation now uses hook chaining instead of overwriting existing hooks ([#272](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/272))
- Hidden commands are excluded from the full command chain in help output ([#238](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/238))

### Fixed

- "Reference not found" error when enabling Entire in an empty repository ([#255](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/255))
- Deleted files in task checkpoints are now correctly computed ([#218](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/218))

### Docs

- Updated sessions-and-checkpoints architecture doc to match codebase ([#217](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/217))
- Fixed incorrect resume documentation ([#224](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/224))
- Added `mise trust` to first-time setup instructions ([#223](https://github.com/entireio/cli/pull/223))

### Thanks

Thanks to @fakepixels, @jaydenfyi, and @kserra1 for contributing to this release!
